block.p: Bush to Seek Big Cut in Medicare and Medicaid Setting the stage for a battle over entitlement spending, President Bush's budget will ask lawmakers to cut more than $70 billion from Medicare and Medicaid in the next five years, officials said. Even some administration officials say they cannot imagine such a large cut being approved.
PAGE A15

Exxon and Shell Report Record Profits for 2006 In earnings reports that are likely to make the oil industry an even bigger target for the Democratic Congress, Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell both posted record profits in 2006. Exxon's profit of $39.5 billion broke the record it set last year for the largest profit ever by an American company.
BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1

Senate Passes Wage Increase The Senate voted to increase the minimum wage to $7.25 an hour and give $8.3 billion in tax cuts to small businesses. The bill passed 94 to 3, but it still must be reconciled with the House's version, which did not include tax breaks, before it can become law.
PAGE A15
The Celebrity Bowl XLI As companies look for ways to give their costly Super Bowl ads a second life on the Web, celebrities like Cindy Crawford, below, are more popular than ever.
BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1
Bull's-Eye Catching The 15 ''Target'' paintings installed in the National Gallery of Art's exhibit of Jasper Johns works still have the power to electrify. A review by Holland Cotter.

Gian Carlo Menotti Is Dead Perhaps the most popular and prolific opera composer of his time, writing ''Amahl and the Night Visitors'' and winning two Pulitzer Prizes, he was 95.
PAGE C11
Report on Sea Rise Due Today The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change will moderate its gloom on sea level rise, lowering its worst-case estimate, people familiar with its deliberations say.
PAGE A11

Guidelines for Flu Pandemic The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued pandemic flu guidelines calling for three-month school closings, sports and movie cancellations and other steps officials said would disrupt public life but would provide time to produce vaccines and save lives.
